abstract: The government says the national health service suffered losses from the drug companies’ efforts to restrict competition in ophthalmic drugs.
snippet: The government says the national health service suffered losses from the drug companies’ efforts to restrict competition in ophthalmic drugs.
lead_paragraph: PARIS — The Italian government is seeking $1.6 billion in damages from two of the world’s biggest drug companies — Novartis and Roche — for losses that it says the national health service incurred from the companies’ efforts to restrict competition in ophthalmic drugs.

headline.main: Italy Seeks $1.6 Billion in Damages From Roche and Novartis
headline.print_headline: Novartis and Roche Face Fines in Italy

byline.original: By David Jolly and Gaia Pianigiani
